title: Свобода, a cyrillic font
content:
Font: 

 DSBroadBrush 

Solved By: 

 [fvilanakis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317130823/http:/typophile.com/user/176276 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [FfmeFYl.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317130823/http:/typophile.com/files/FfmeFYl.jpg) | 146.31 KB |
author: get8p

comments.content:
It must be **DSBroadBrush** by Dubina Nikolay [D-Studio, 1999]  
More on D-Studio fonts:  
 [http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-26598.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317130823/http:/luc.devroye.org/fonts-26598.html "http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-26598.html")

There is also a font which matches (at least ) the latin subset which is named **ft18** by FT Content Provider.  
More on FT Content Provider:  
 [http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-42785.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317130823/http:/luc.devroye.org/fonts-42785.html "http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-42785.html")

Chances are that **DSBroadBrush** is the original and **ft18** is a non legitimate clone, so please take care on using/licensing.

But that's great, thanks a lot!

Tell me something, how were you able to find that out?

I'm glad that was helpful :)

I'm the designer/programmer of a special piece of software called "Find my Font" which does exactly that:  
It recognizes the fonts used in a bitmap image.  
You can find more details and download a trial edition here:  
 [http://www.findmyfont.com/index.php/find-my-font/features](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317130823/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/find-my-font/features "http://www.findmyfont.com/index.php/find-my-font/features")

Cheers  
Fivos
